intro: Cupania exangulata, commonly known as the Brazilian arrowroot, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces edible tubers that are similar in texture to yams and are used in traditional cuisine. It thrives in moist, tropical environments and is often found in forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for both ecological and agricultural studies.
